abstract.para: This file provides documentation for file 94boct05.dat, a comma delimited file that contains bromide concentrations over time at two sites on the Blueberry Creek August 6, 1994.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Sodium Bromide was added to Blueberry Creek 165 meters downstream of the Lake I8 outlet. With samples taken 182 meters (NR4) and 600 meters (NR9) downstream from the injection location.

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATA RECEIVED: June 1997 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Karie Slavik DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: DATA:

para.literalLayout: Estimates of travel time were made to guide the collection of physical samples. Samples were collected in borsilicate glass vials at irregular time intervals weighted to cover the rising and falling limbs more intensively than other time periods. Sample concentrations were determined on a Orion 290A multimeter with a bromide selective electrode and a reference electrode. Injection Start: 0 minutes Injection End: 240 minutes

Notes: (11) VARIABLE DESCRIPTIONS: Precis. Coded? Missing Variable Variable Description Units (Y/N) Values Site site of measurements y n D/D distance from NaBr dripper 5m n n Date date dd-mmm-yy n n Location Sampling location n n ET elapse time minutes n n Br Bromide mg/L n n Comments Comments

Reference Citations: Kilpatrick,F.A. and Cobb,E.D. 1985. Measurement of discharge using tracers. Techniques of Water-Resource Investigations of the United States Geological Survey. Stream Solute Workshop 1990. Concepts and methods for assessing solute dynamics in stream ecosystems. J. N. Amer. Benthol. Soc., 9(2):95-119.
